name: Lorenz-96 model (chaotic regime)
description_simple: A high-dimensional chaotic system widely used in climate and data assimilation research.
description_complex: The Lorenz-96 system is a spatially extended ODE defined on a cyclic domain, originally introduced to model simplified atmospheric dynamics. For forcing F = 8, the system exhibits high-dimensional deterministic chaos with multiple positive Lyapunov exponents, strong sensitivity to initial conditions, and statistical predictability of ensemble properties.
